xxl.core.relational
Class Types

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.relational.Types

public final class Types
extends Object

This class provides a set of type codes that can be used to identify Java types. It also provides methods for converting type codes into type names and back again and methods to resolve adequate Java types for SQL types and vice versa. The present type mapping follows the conventions made in the chapter Mapping SQL and Java Types available here.

See Also:
Types

Method Detail

getJavaType

public static int getJavaType(int sqlType)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
Determines a Java type that is able to store an object of the specified SQL type.

Parameters:
sqlType - the SQL type code for which an adequate Java type should be resolved.
Returns:
a Java type that is able to store an object of the specified SQL type.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the SQL type code is unknown.

getJavaTypeCode

public static int getJavaTypeCode(String javaTypeName)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
Resolve the type code of the specified Java type name.

Parameters:
javaTypeName - the name of the Java type whose type code should be resolved.
Returns:
the type code of the specified Java type.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the Java type name is unknown.

Returns:
the name of the specified Java type code.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the Java type code is unknown.

getColumnMetaData

public static ColumnMetaData getColumnMetaData(int javaType)
Creates a column metadata describing a column holding objects of the specified Java type.

Parameters:
javaType - the Java type the column must be able to store.
Returns:
a column metadata describing a column holding objects of the specified Java type.

getColumnMetaData

public static ColumnMetaData getColumnMetaData(int javaType,
                                               Object javaObject)
Creates a column metadata describing a column holding the given object of the specified Java type. The object is used to determine the columns precision and scale (for String, BigDecimal, Float, Double and byte[] objects), otherwise it is ignored.

Parameters:
javaType - the Java type the column must be able to store.
javaObject - the Java object used for determining the columns precision and scale.
Returns:
a column metadata describing a column holding the given object of the specified Java type.

getObjectSize

public static int getObjectSize(int sqlType,
                                int precision)
Determines the object size of an object of the given SQL type and precision.

Parameters:
sqlType - the SQL type of the object whose objects size should be determined.
precision - the precision of the object whose objects size should be determined.
Returns:
the object size of an object of the given SQL type and precision.

getObjectSize

public static int getObjectSize(ColumnMetaData columnMetaData)
Determines the object size of an object stored in a relational column specified by the given column metadata.

Parameters:
columnMetaData - the column metadata describing the column whose object size should be determined.
Returns:
the object size of an object stored in a relational column specified by the given column metadata.

getObjectSize

public static int getObjectSize(ResultSetMetaData resultSetMetaData,
                                int column)
Determines the object size of an object stored in the columnth column of a table specified by the given relational metadata.

Parameters:
resultSetMetaData - the relational metadata describing the table storing the desired colum.
column - the index of the desired column inside the table specified by the given relational metadata.
Returns:
the object size of an object stored in the columnth column of a table specified by the given relational metadata.

Parameters:

Returns:

areComparable

public static boolean areComparable(int type1,
                                    int type2)
Determines whether the given Java types are comparable.

Parameters:
type1 - the first Java type to be checked.
type2 - the second Java type to be checked.
Returns:
true if the given Java types are comparable, otherwise false.
